ProcedureHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: PROC CUSUM < options >;
    XCHART statement...
    INSET statement...
  
The CUSUM procedure creates cumulative sum control charts, also known as cusum 
charts, which display cumulative sums of the deviations of measurements or subgroup 
means from a target value.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ANNOTATE=SAS-data-set] 
      
Specifies an input data set that contains appropriate annotate variables.

[Syntax: ANNOTATE2=SAS-data-set] 
      
Specifies an input data set that contains appropriate annotate variables that add 
features to the trend chart (secondary chart) produced with the TRENDVAR= option 
in the XCHART statement.

[Syntax: DATA=SAS-data-set] 
      
Names an input data set that contains raw data (measurements) as observations.

[Syntax: FORMCHAR(index)='string'] 
      
Defines characters used for features on line printer charts.
      
The features associated with values of index are as follows: 

Index   Description of Character      Chart Feature  
1       vertical bar                  frame 
2       horizontal bar                frame, central line 
3       box character (upper left)    frame 
4       box character (upper middle)  serifs, tick (horizontal axis) 
5       box character (upper right)   frame 
6       box character (middle left)   not used 
7       box character (middle middle) serifs 
8       box character (middle right)  tick (vertical axis) 
9       box character (lower left)    frame 
10      box character (lower middle)  serifs 
11      box character (lower right)   frame 
12      vertical bar                  control limits 
13      horizontal bar                control limits 
14      box character (upper right)   control limits 
15      box character (lower left)    control limits 
16      box character (lower right)   control limits 
17      box character (upper left)    control limits

[Syntax: GOUT=graphics-catalog] 
      
Specifies the graphics catalog for traditional graphics output from PROC CUSUM.

[Syntax: HISTORY=SAS-data-set] 
      
Names an input data set that contains subgroup summary statistics (means, standard deviations, 
and sample sizes).

[Syntax: LIMITS=SAS-data-set] 
      
Names an input data set that contains a set of decision interval or V-mask parameters.

Requests that line printer charts be produced. By default, the procedure creates 
traditional graphics.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ALPHA=value] 
          
Specifies the probability, α, of incorrectly deciding that a shift has occurred 
when the process mean is equal to the target mean.

[Syntax: BETA=value] 
          
Specifies the probability, β, of failing to discover that the specified shift has occurred.

[Syntax: CINFILL=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the area under the decision interval or inside the V-mask arms.

[Syntax: CLIMITS=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the decision interval line.

[Syntax: CMASK=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the V-mask arms.

Computes cumulative sums without standardizing the subgroup means or individual 
measurements.

[Syntax: DELTA=value] 
          
Specifies the absolute value of the smallest shift to be detected as a multiple delta 
of the process standard deviation, σ, or the standard error, σX-bar, depending on whether 
delta is viewed as a shift in the population mean or a shift in the sampling distribution 
of the subgroup mean , respectively.

[Syntax: H=value] 
          
Specifies the decision interval h for a one-sided cusum scheme.

[Syntax: HEADSTART=value] 
          
Specifies a headstart value S0 for a one-sided cusum scheme.

[Syntax: K=value] 
          
Specifies the reference value k for a one-sided (decision interval) cusum scheme.

[Syntax: LLIMITS=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for the decision interval. The default is 4, which produces 
a dashed line.

[Syntax: LMASK=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for the V-mask arms.

[Syntax: MU0=value] 
          
Specifies the target mean u0 for the process. The target mean must be scaled in the 
same units as the data.
Suppresses calculation of average run lengths.
Suppresses the display of the V-mask on charts for two-sided schemes.

Specifies that the cusum scheme parameters for each process listed in the chart statement are not 
to be read from the LIMITS= data set specified in the PROC CUSUM statement.

[Syntax: ORIGIN=value] 
          
Specifies the origin of the V-mask, which is defined as the horizontal coordinate of 
the right edge of the V-mask.

[Syntax: READINDEX='value'] 
          
Reads cusum scheme parameters from a LIMITS= data set (specified in the PROC CUSUM 
statement) for each process listed in the chart statement.

Specifies that cusum scheme parameters are to be read from a LIMITS= data set specified 
in the PROC CUSUM statement.

Specifies that the variable _SIGMAS_ (instead of _ALPHA_) is to be read from a LIMITS= 
data set that contains both variables.

Indicates whether the cusum scheme is a one-sided (decision interval) scheme or a two-sided scheme 
with a V-mask.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Cusum scheme is a one-sided (decision interval) scheme.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Cusum scheme is a two-sided scheme.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: SHIFT=value] 
          
Specifies the shift to be detected in the same units as the data.

[Syntax: SIGMA0=value] 
          
Specifies a known standard deviation, σ0, for the process standard deviation, σ.

[Syntax: SIGMAS=value] 
          
Specifies the probability α of false detection for a two-sided cusum scheme with a 
V-mask as the probability that the absolute value of a standard normally distributed 
variable is greater than the value.
Specifies a method for estimating the process standard deviation, σ.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Estimates σ as an unweighted average of unbiased subgroup estimates of σ.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Calculates a minimum variance linear unbiased estimate for σ
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Calculates a root-mean square estimate for σ

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Requests all the tables specified by the options TABLECHART, TABLECOMP, TABLEID, TABLEOUT, 
and TABLESUMMARY.

[Syntax: TABLECHART <(EXCEPTIONS)>] 
          
Creates a table of the subgroup variable, the subgroup sample sizes, the subgroup means, the 
cumulative sums, and the decision interval or V-mask limits.

Tabulates the computational form of the cusum scheme as described by Lucas (1976) and Lucas and 
Crosier (1982).

Augments the tables specified by the TABLECHART and TABLECOMP options with a column for each of the 
ID variables.

Augments the table specified by the TABLECHART option with a column indicating whether the decision 
interval or V-mask values are exceeded.
Produces a table that summarizes the cusum scheme.
Specifies the value of _TYPE_ in an OUTLIMITS= data set.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: The variable _STDDEV_ in the OUTLIMITS= data set represents an estimate Value.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: The variable _STDDEV_ in the OUTLIMITS= data set represents a standard (known) value.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: WMASK=linetype] 
          
Specifies the width (in pixels) of the V-mask arms.

[Syntax: ALLLABEL=VALUE | (variable)] 
          
Labels every point on the primary chart with the VALUE plotted for that subgroup or with the value 
of a variable in the input data set.

[Syntax: ALLLABEL2=VALUE | (variable)] 
          
Labels every point on an R, s, or trend chart with the VALUE plotted for that subgroup
or with the value of a variable in the input data set.

Plots summary statistics for all subgroups, regardless of whether the subgroup sample size equals 
the nominal control limit sample size n specified by the LIMITN= option or the variable _LIMITN_ 
in the LIMITS= data set.

[Syntax: ANNOTATE=SAS-data-set] 
          
Specifies an ANNOTATE= type data set.

[Syntax: ANNOTATE2=SAS-data-set] 
          
Specifies an ANNOTATE= type data set that enhances a primary chart.

Arranges the Shewhart chart in two levels (rather than the default of one level) so that twice as 
much data can be displayed on a page or screen.
Specifies the position of a block-variable label in the block legend.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Places the label immediately above the legend.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Places the label to the left of the legend.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Places the label to the right of the legend.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies how lengthy block variable values are treated when there is insufficient space to display 
them in the block legend.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: The values are uniformly reduced in height so that they fit.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Lengthy values are truncated on the right until they fit.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Rotates the values of the block variable displayed closest to the chart by 90 degreest.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: RotateS the values of all block variables.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies the vertical position of the legend for the values of the block variables.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Top of chart, offset from axis frame
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Top of chart, immediately above axis frame
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Bottom of chart, immediately above horizontal axis
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Bottom of chart, below horizontal axis label

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax:BLOCKREFOPACITY=value] 
          
Specifies the wall fill opacity for blocks and phases when transparency is used in ODS Graphics  
output. The value must be between 0 and 1, where 0 is completely transparent and 1 is completely 
opaque. The default wall fill opacity is 0.15.

Specifies that block variable values for all groups be displayed. By default, only the first block 
variable value in any block is displayed, and repeated block variable values are not displayed.

[Syntax: BLOCKVAR=variable | (variable-list)] 
          
Specifies variables whose values are used to assign colors for filling the background of the legend 
associated with block variables.

Specifies that the points representing subgroup means, medians, maximum values, minimum values, first 
quartiles or third quartiles in box-and-whisker plots created with the BOXCHART statement are to be 
connected.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that the points in box-and-whiskers plots created with the BOXCHART statement representing group means be connected with line segments.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that the points in box-and-whiskers plots created with the BOXCHART statement representing group medians be connected with line segments.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Specifies that the points in box-and-whiskers plots created with the BOXCHART statement representing group maximum values be connected with line segments.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Specifies that the points in box-and-whiskers plots created with the BOXCHART statement representing group minimum values be connected with line segments.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Specifies that the points in box-and-whiskers plots created with the BOXCHART statement representing group first quartiles be connected with line segments.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Specifies that the points in box-and-whiskers plots created with the BOXCHART statement representing group third quartiles be connected with line segments.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: BOXES=(variable)] 
          
Specifies a variable whose values are used to assign colors for the outlines of box-and-whiskers plots.

[Syntax: BOXFILL=variable | NONE | EMPTY] 
          
Specifies how box-and-whisker plots are filled with colors from the ODS style.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: You can specify a variable whose values are used to group box-and-whiskers plots for assigning fill colors from the ODS style.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Produces unfilled boxes.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: BOXOPACITY=value] 
          
Specifies the box fill opacity for box-and-whisker charts when transparency is used in ODS Graphics  
output. The value must be between 0 and 1, where 0 is completely transparent and 1 is completely opaque. 
The default box fill opacity is 0.75.
[Specifies the style of the box-and-whiskers plots displayed.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: The whiskers are drawn from the edges of the box to the extreme values of the group.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: A whisker is drawn from the upper edge of the box to the largest observed value within the upper fence,  and another is drawn from the lower edge of the box to the smallest observed value within the lower fence.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: A schematic box-and-whiskers plot is displayed in which an ID variable value is used to label the  symbol marking each observation outside the upper and lower fences.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: A schematic box-and-whiskers plot is displayed in which the value of the ID variable is used to label the symbol marking each observation outside the lower and upper far fences
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: All the values in the subgroup sample are plotted as points, and neither a box nor whiskers are drawn.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: All the values in the subgroup sample are plotted as points joined with a vertical line. Neither a  box nor whiskers are drawn.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip7: All the values in the subgroup sample are plotted as points enclosed in a box.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip8: All the values in the subgroup sample are plotted using labels specified as the values of the first  variable in the ID statement.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip9: All the values in the subgroup sample are plotted using labels specified as the values of the first  variable in the ID statement, and the values are joined by a vertical line.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip10: A schematic box chart is overlaid with points plotting all observations in the subgroups.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: BOXWIDTH=value] 
          
Specifies the width (in horizontal percent screen units) of the box-and-whiskers plots.

[Syntax: BOXWIDTHSCALE=value] 
          
Specifies that the width of the box-and-whiskers plots created with the BOXCHART statement is to vary
proportionately to a particular function of the group size n.

[Syntax: CAXIS=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the axes and tick marks. This option overrides any COLOR= specifications 
in an AXIS statement.

[Syntax: CBLOCKLAB=color | (color-list)] 
          
Specifies fill colors for the frames that enclose the block variable labels in a block legend.

[Syntax: CBLOCKVAR=variable | (variable-list)] 
          
Specifies variables whose values are colors for filling the background of the legend associated 
with block variables.

[Syntax: CBOXES=color | (variable)] 
          
Specifies the colors for the outlines of the box-and-whiskers plots created with the BOXCHART statement.

[Syntax: CBOXFILL=color | (variable)] 
          
Specifies the interior fill colors for the box-and-whiskers plots created with the BOXCHART statement.

[Syntax: CCLIP=color] 
          
Specifies a color for the plotting symbol that is specified with the CLIPSYMBOL= option to mark 
clipped values.

[Syntax: CCONNECT=color] 
          
Specifies the color for line segments connecting points on the chart.

[Syntax: CCOVERLAY=(color-list)] 
          
Specifies the colors for line segments connecting points on primary chart overlays.

[Syntax: CCOVERLAY2=(color-list)] 
          
Specifies the colors for line segments connecting points on secondary chart overlays.

[Syntax: CFRAME=color] 
          
Specifies the color for filling the rectangle enclosed by the axes and the frame. By default, this 
area is not filled. The CFRAME= option cannot be used in conjunction with the NOFRAME option.

[Syntax: CFRAMELAB=color] 
          
Specifies the color for filling rectangles that frame the point labels displayed with the ALLLABEL=, 
ALLLABEL2=, OUTLABEL=, and OUTLABEL2= options.

Syntax: CGRID=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the grid requested by the ENDGRID or GRID option. By default, the grid 
is the same color as the axes.

[Syntax: CHREF=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the lines requested by the HREF= and HREF2= options.

[Syntax: CIINDICES <(<TYPE=keyword<ALPHA=value>)>] 
          
Requests capability index confidence limits based on subgroup summary data, calculated using 
"effective degrees of freedom".

TYPE=keyword 
specifies the type of confidence limit. Valid values are LOWER, UPPER and TWOSIDED. The default 
value is TWOSIDED. 

ALPHA=value 
specifies the default confidence level to compute confidence limits. The percentage for the confidence 
limits is (1-value)*100.

[Syntax: CLABEL=color] 
          
Specifies the color for labels produced by the ALLLABEL=, ALLLABEL2=, OUTLABEL=, and OUTLABEL2= options.

[Syntax: CLIPCHAR='character'] 
          
Specifies a plot character that identifies clipped points, as requested with the CLIPFACTOR= option.

[Syntax: CLIPFACTOR=factor] 
          
Requests clipping of extreme values on the control chart. The factor that you specify determines 
the extent to which these values are clipped, and it must be greater than 1.

[Syntax: CLIPLEGEND='label'] 
          
Specifies the label for the legend that indicates the number of clipped boxes when the CLIPFACTOR= 
option is used.

Specifies the position for the legend that indicates the number of clipped boxes when the CLIPFACTOR= 
option is used.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Positions the legend at the top of the chart.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: positions the legend at the bottom of the chart.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: CLIPSUBCHAR='character'] 
          
Specifies a substitution character (such as '#') for the label provided with the CLIPLEGEND= option.

[Syntax: CLIPSYMBOL=symbol] 
          
Specifies a plot symbol used to identify clipped points on the chart and in the legend when the 
CLIPFACTOR= option is used.

[Syntax: CLIPSYMBOLHT=value] 
          
Specifies the height for the symbol marker used to identify clipped points on the chart when the 
CLIPFACTOR= option is used.

[Syntax: CNEEDLES=color] 
          
Requests that points are to be connected to the central line with vertical line segments (needles) 
and specifies the color of the needles.

[Syntax: CONNECTCHAR='character'] 
          
Specifies the character used to form line segments that connect points on a chart. The default
character is a plus (+) sign.

Specifies whether the control limits displayed in a box chart are to be computed for subgroup means 
or for subgroup medians.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies whether the control limits displayed in a box chart are to be computed for subgroup means.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies whether the control limits displayed in a box chart are to be computed for subgroup medians.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Specify COUT with no argument to use an appropriate contrasting color from the ODS style.

[Syntax: COUT=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the plotting symbols and the portions of connecting line segments that lie 
outside the control limits.

[Syntax: COUTFILL=color] 
          
Specifies the fill color for the areas outside the control limits that lie between the connected 
points and the control limits and are bounded by connecting lines. This option is useful for 
highlighting out-of-control points. See Figure 59.11 for an example. By default, these areas are 
not filled. You can use the OUTFILL option to fill this area with an appropriate color from the 
ODS style. Note that you can use the CINFILL= option to fill the area inside the control limits.

[Syntax: COVERLAY=(color-list)] 
          
Specifies the colors used to plot primary chart overlay variables. Colors in the COVERLAY= list
are matched with variables in the corresponding positions in the OVERLAY= list.

[Syntax: COVERLAY2=(color-list)] 
          
Specifies the colors used to plot secondary chart overlay variables. Colors in the COVERLAY2= list 
are matched with variables in the corresponding positions in the OVERLAY2= list.

[Syntax: COVERLAYCLIP=color] 
          
Specifies the color used to plot clipped values on overlay plots when the CLIPFACTOR= option is used.

[Syntax: CPHASEBOX=color] 
          
Specifies the color for a box that encloses all of the plotted points for a phase (group of 
consecutive observations that have the same value of the variable _PHASE_).

[Syntax: CPHASEBOXCONNECT=color] 
          
Specifies the color for line segments that connect the vertical edges of adjacent enclosing boxes 
requested with the CPHASEBOX= option or the CPHASEBOXFILL= option.

[Syntax: CPHASEBOXFILL=color] 
          
Specifies the fill color for a box that encloses all of the plotted points for a phase.

[Syntax: CPHASELEG=color] 
          
Specifies a text color for the phase labels requested with the PHASELEGEND option.

[Syntax: CPHASEMEANCONNECT=color] 
          
Specifies the color for line segments that connect points representing the average of the values 
plotted within a phase.

[Syntax: CSTARCIRCLES=color] 
          
Specifies a color for the circles requested with the STARCIRCLES= option.

[Syntax: CSTARFILL=color | CSTARFILL=(variable)] 
          
Specifies a color or colors for filling the interior of stars requested with the STARVERTICES= option.

[Syntax: CSTAROUT=color] 
          
Specifies to use an appropriate contrasting color from the ODS style for those portions of the 
outlines of stars (requested with the STARVERTICES= option) that exceed the inner or outer circles.

[Syntax: CSTAROUT=color] 
          
Specifies a color for those portions of the outlines of stars (requested with the STARVERTICES= option) 
that exceed the inner or outer circles.

[Syntax: CSTARS=color | CSTARS=(variable)] 
          
Specifies a color or colors for the outlines of stars requested with the STARVERTICES= option.
Specifies a label for the central line in a C chart.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: C
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: CBAR
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: You can specify a quoted label of length 16 or less.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: CTESTLABBOX=color] 
          
Specifies the color for boxes enclosing labels for positive tests for special causes requested with 
the TESTLABBOX option.

[Syntax:CTESTS=color | test-color-list] 
          
Specifies colors for labels indicating points where a test is positive.

[Syntax: CTESTSYMBOL=color] 
          
Specifies the color of the symbol used to plot subgroups with positive tests for special causes.

[Syntax: CTEXT=color] 
          
Specifies the color for tick mark values and axis labels. The default color is the 
color specified in the CTEXT= option in the most recent GOPTIONS statement.

[Syntax: CVREF=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the lines requested by the VREF= and VREF2= options.

[Syntax: CZONES=color] 
          
Requests lines marking zones A, B, and C for the tests for special causes 
(see the TESTS= option) and specifies the color for these lines.

[Syntax: DESCRIPTION='string'] 
          
Specifies a description for the primary chart of length 256 or less that appears 
in the PROC GREPLAY master menu. The default string is the variable name. A related 
option is NAME=.

[Syntax: DESCRIPTION2='string'] 
          
Specifies a description for the secondary chart of length 256 or less that appears 
in the PROC GREPLAY master menu. The default string is the variable name. The DESCRIPTION2= 
option is available in the IRCHART, MRCHART, XRCHART, and XSCHART statements, and it is 
used in conjunction with the SEPARATE option. A related option is NAME2=.

Specifies that numeric subgroup variable values be treated as discrete values, 
so that each tick value on the default subgroup axis corresponds to a unique 
subgroup variable value.

Adds a grid to the rightmost portion of the chart, beginning with the first labeled 
major tick mark position that follows the last plotted point.

Creates a control chart only when exceptions occur, specifically, when the control 
limits are exceeded or when any of the tests requested with the TESTS= option or 
the TESTS2= option are positive.

[Syntax: FONT=font] 
          
Specifies a software font for labels and legends.

Draws reference lines specified with the HREF= and VREF= options in front of box-and-whiskers 
plots. By default, reference lines are drawn behind the box-and-whiskers plots and can be 
obscured by filled boxes.

Adds a grid to the control chart. Grid lines are horizontal lines positioned at 
labeled major tick marks, and they cover the length and height of the plotting area.

[Syntax: HAXIS=values | HAXIS=AXISn] 
          
Specifies tick mark values for the horizontal (subgroup) axis. If the group variable 
is numeric, the values must be numeric and equally spaced. If the group variable is 
character, values must be quoted strings of up to 16 characters. Optionally, you can 
specify an axis name defined in a previous AXIS statement.

[Syntax: HEIGHT=value] 
          
Specifies the height (in vertical screen percent units) of the text for axis labels 
and legends. This value takes precedence over the HTEXT= value specified in the GOPTIONS 
statement.

[Syntax: HMINOR=n] 
          
Specifies the number of minor tick marks between major tick marks on the horizontal 
axis. Minor tick marks are not labeled. The default is HMINOR=0.

[Syntax: HOFFSET=value] 
          
Specifies the length (in percent screen units) of the offset at both ends of the 
horizontal axis. You can eliminate the offset by specifying HOFFSET=0.

[Syntax: HREF=values | HREF=SAS-data-set] 
          
Draws reference lines perpendicular to the horizontal (subgroup) axis on the 
primary chart.

[Syntax: HREF2=values | HREF=SAS-data-set] 
          
Draws reference lines perpendicular to the horizontal (subgroup) axis on the 
secondary chart.

[Syntax: HREF2DATA=SAS-data-set] 
          
Draws reference lines perpendicular to the horizontal (subgroup) axis on the 
secondary chart. The HREF2DATA= option must be used in place of the HREF2= 
option to specify a data set using the quoted filename notation.

[Syntax: HREF2LABELS='label1' ...'labeln'] 
          
Specifies labels for the reference lines requested by the HREF2= option. The number 
of labels must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can 
be up to 16 characters.

[Syntax: HREFCHAR='character'] 
          
Specifies the character used for reference lines requested by the HREF= and HREF2= 
options on line printer charts. The default is the vertical bar (|).

[Syntax: HREFDATA=SAS-data-set] 
          
Draws reference lines perpendicular to the horizontal (subgroup) axis on the primary 
chart. The HREFDATA= option must be used in place of the HREF= option to specify a 
data set using the quoted filename notation.

[Syntax: HREFLABELS='label1' ...'labeln'] 
          
Specifies labels for the reference lines requested by the HREF= option. The number 
of labels must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can 
be up to 16 characters.
Specifies the vertical position of the HREFLABEL= label.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Along top of subplot area
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Staggered from top to bottom of subplot area
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Staggered from bottom to top of subplot area

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: HTML=variable] 
          
Specifies URLs as values of the specified character variable (or formatted values 
of a numeric variable). These URLs are associated with points on a primary control 
chart when traditional graphics output is directed into HTML.

[Syntax: HTML2=variable] 
          
Specifies URLs as values of the specified character variable (or formatted values 
of a numeric variable). These URLs are associated with points on a secondary chart 
when traditional graphics output is directed into HTML.

[Syntax: HTML_LEGEND=variable] 
          
Specifies URLs as values of the specified character variable (or formatted values 
of a numeric variable). These URLs are associated with symbols in the legend for 
the levels of a symbol-variable.

[Syntax: IDCOLOR=color] 
          
Specifies the color of the symbol marker used to identify outliers in schematic 
box-and-whiskers plots (that is, when you specify the keyword SCHEMATIC, SCHEMATICID, 
or SCHEMATICIDFAR with the BOXSTYLE= option).

[Syntax: IDCTEXT=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the text used to label outliers when you specify the keyword 
SCHEMATICID, SCHEMATICIDFAR, POINTSID, or POINTSJOINID with the BOXSTYLE= option.

[Syntax: IDFONT=font] 
          
Specifies the font for the text used to label outliers when you specify the keyword 
SCHEMATICID, SCHEMATICIDFAR, POINTSID, or POINTSJOINID with the BOXSTYLE= option.

[Syntax: IDHEIGHT=value] 
          
Specifies the height for the text used to label outliers when you specify the keyword 
SCHEMATICID, SCHEMATICIDFAR, POINTSID, or POINTSJOINID with the BOXSTYLE= option.

[Syntax: IDSYMBOL=symbol] 
          
Specifies the symbol marker used to identify outliers in schematic box-and-whisker 
plots produced with the BOXCHART statement when you use one of the following options: 
BOXSTYLE=SCHEMATIC, BOXSTYLE=SCHEMATICID, and BOXSTYLE=SCHEMATICIDFAR. 

The default symbol is SQUARE.

Specifies that the widths of the zones requested with the ZONES option be computed 
independently above and below the center line of the chart, so that the width of 
each zone is one-third of the difference between the process mean and the control 
limit on its side of the chart.

[Syntax: INFILLOPACITY=value] 
          
Specifies the control limit infill opacity when transparency is used in ODS Graphics 
output. The value be between 0 and 1, where 0 is completely transparent and 1 is 
completely opaque. The default control limit infill opacity is 0.25.

Specifies the natural time interval between consecutive group positions when a time, 
date, or datetime format is associated with a numeric group variable.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: For DATE, WEEKDATE, WORDDATE, YYMMDD, or MMDDYY format
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: For DATETIME format

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: INTSTART=value] 
          
Specifies the starting value for a numeric horizontal axis when a date, time, or 
datetime format is associated with the group variable.

[Syntax: LABELANGLE=angle] 
          
Specifies the angle at which labels requested with the ALLLABEL=, ALLLABEL2=, OUTLABEL=, 
and OUTLABEL2= options are drawn. A positive angle rotates the labels counterclockwise; 
a negative angle rotates them clockwise. By default, labels are oriented horizontally.

[Syntax: LABELFONT=font] 
          
Specifies a software font for labels requested with the ALLLABEL=, ALLLABEL2=, OUTLABEL=, 
OUTLABEL2=, STARLABEL=, TESTLABEL=, and TESTLABELn= options.

[Syntax: LABELHEIGHT=value] 
          
Specifies the height (in vertical percent screen units) for labels requested with 
the ALLLABEL=, ALLLABEL2=, OUTLABEL=, OUTLABEL2=, STARLABEL=, TESTLABEL=, and 
TESTLABEL= options.

[Syntax: LBOXES=linetype | LBOXES=(variable)] 
          
Specifies the line types for the outlines of the box-and-whiskers plots created with 
the BOXCHART statement.

[Syntax: LCLLABEL='label'] 
          
Specifies a label for the lower control limit in the primary chart. The label can 
be of length 16 or less. Enclose the label in quotes.

[Syntax: LCLLABEL2='label'] 
          
Specifies a label for the lower control limit in the secondary chart. The label can 
be of length 16 or less. Enclose the label in quotes.

[Syntax: LENDGRID=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for the grid requested with the ENDGRID option. The default 
value is 1, which produces a solid line.

[Syntax: LGRID=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for the grid requested with the GRID option. The default 
value is 1, which produces a solid line.

[Syntax: LHREF=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for reference lines requested with the HREF= and HREF2 
options. The default value is 2, which produces a dashed line.

[Syntax: LIMITN=n | VARYING] 
          
Specifies a fixed nominal sample size for the control limits. 

LIMITN=VARYING specifies a varying nominal sample size for the control limits.

[Syntax: LIMITN=VARYING] 
          
Specifies a varying nominal sample size for the control limits.

[Syntax: LIMLABSUBCHAR='character'] 
          
Specifies a substitution character (such as #) for labels provided as quoted strings 
with the LCLLABEL=, LCLLABEL2=, UCLLABEL=, UCLLABEL2=, CSYMBOL=, NPSYMBOL=, PSYMBOL=, 
RSYMBOL=, SSYMBOL=, USYMBOL=, and XSYMBOL= options.

[Syntax: LOVERLAY=(linetypes)] 
          
Specifies line types for the line segments connecting points on primary chart overlays. 
Line types in the LOVERLAY= list are matched with variables in the corresponding positions 
in the OVERLAY= list.

[Syntax: LOVERLAY2=(linetypes)] 
          
Specifies line types for the line segments connecting points on secondary chart 
overlays. Line types in the LOVERLAY2= list are matched with variables in the 
corresponding positions in the OVERLAY2= list.

[Syntax: LSL=value-list] 
          
Provides lower specification limits used to compute capability indices.

[Syntax: LSTARCIRCLES=linetypes] 
          
Specifies one or more line types for the circles requested with the STARCIRCLES= option.

[Syntax: LSTARS=linetype | LSTARS=(variable)] 
          
Specifies the line types for the outlines of stars requested with the STARVERTICES= 
option.

[Syntax: LTESTS=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for the line segments that connect patterns of points for 
which a test for special causes (requested with the TESTS= option) is positive. 
The default is 1, which produces a solid line.

[Syntax: LTMARGIN=value] 
          
Specifies the width of the left marginal area for the plot requested with the 
LTMPLOT= option.

Requests a univariate plot of the control chart statistics that is positioned in the 
left margin of the control chart.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Histogram
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Digidot plot
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Schematic box-and-whisker plot with outliers labeled
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Schematic box-and-whisker plot with far outliers labeled

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: LVREF=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for reference lines requested by the VREF= and VREF2= options. 
The default value is 2, which produces a dashed line.

[Syntax: LZONES=n] 
          
Specifies the line type for lines that delineate zones A, B, and C for standard tests 
requested with the TESTS= and/or TESTS2= options. The default is n=2, which produces a 
dashed line.

[Syntax: MAXPANELS=n] 
          
Specifies the maximum number of pages or screens for a chart. By default, n=20.

Identifies a method for estimating the process mean, µ, which is represented by the central line on 
a median chart.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Average of subgroup means
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Average of subgroup medians

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Determines how subgroups are formed when observations are read from a DATA= data set 
and a character subgroup-variable is provided.

Causes the moving range computation on the IRCHART to be restarted when any missing 
value is encountered.

[Syntax: MRRESTART=value] '
          
Causes the moving range computation on the IRCHART to be restarted only when the 
specified missing value is encountered.

[Syntax: NAME='string'] 
          
Specifies a name for the primary chart of length 8 or less that appears in the 
PROC GREPLAY master menu. The default name is 'SHEWHART'.

[Syntax: NAME2='string'] 
          
Specifies a name for the secondary chart of length 8 or less that appears in the 
PROC GREPLAY master menu. The default name is 'SHEWHART'.

[Syntax: NDECIMAL=n] 
          
Specifies the number of decimal digits in the default labels for the control limits 
and the central line in the primary chart.

[Syntax: NDECIMAL2=n] 
          
Specifies the number of decimal digits in the default labels for the control limits 
and the central line in a secondary chart.
Connects plotted points to the central line with vertical line segments (needles).

Identifies a plotted subgroup summary statistic with a special symbol marker (character) 
when the corresponding subgroup sample size is not equal to the nominal control limit 
sample size n.
Suppresses the check for 3σ limits when tests for special causes are requested.
Suppresses block and phase reference lines from ODS Graphics output.

Suppresses the block and phase wall fills from ODS Graphics output. By default, block 
and phase walls are filled when ODS Graphics is in effect.
Suppresses the legend for the levels of a BOXFILL= or STARFILL= variable in ODS Graphics output.

Specifies that the reference line information in an HREF=, HREF2=, VREF=, or VREF2= 
data set be applied uniformly to box plots created for all the BY groups in the 
input data set. If you specify the NOBYREF option, you do not need to provide BY 
variables in the reference line data set. By default, you must provide BY variables.

Suppresses the creation of the chart. You typically specify the NOCHART option when 
you are using the procedure to compute control limits and save them in an output 
data set.

Suppresses the creation of a secondary chart. You typically use this option in the 
IRCHART statement to create a chart for individual measurements and suppress the 
accompanying chart for moving ranges.
Suppresses line segments that connect points on the chart.
Suppresses the display of the central line in a primary chart.
Suppresses the display of the central line in a secondary chart.
Suppresses the default frame drawn around the chart.
Suppresses the label for the horizontal (subgroup) axis.
Suppresses the display of the lower control limit in a primary chart.
Suppresses the display of the lower control limit in a secondary chart.

Suppresses the default legend for subgroup sample sizes, which appears by default 
below the chart.

Suppresses the display of a fixed lower control limit if and only if the value of 
the limit is zero.

Suppresses the display of a fixed upper control limit on a p chart if and only if the 
value of the control limit is 1 (or 100%), or on an np chart if and only if the value 
of the control limit is n.
Suppresses the default labels for the control limits and central lines.
Suppresses the display of control limits.

Suppresses the default frame for the control limit information that is displayed 
across the top of the chart when multiple sets of control limits with distinct 
multiples of σ and nominal control limit sample sizes are read from a LIMITS= 
data set.

Suppresses the legend for the control limits, which appears by default in the upper 
right corner of the chart.

Suppresses the legend for overlay variables which is displayed by default when 
the OVERLAY= or OVERLAY2= option is specified.
Suppresses the default frame for the legend requested by the PHASELEGEND option.
Specifies that box-and-whiskers plots created by the BOXCHART statement are to be notched.

Specifies that tests for special causes requested with the TESTS= or TESTS2= options 
not be applied across the boundaries of phases (blocks of consecutive subgroups) 
determined by the READPHASES= option and the variable _PHASE_ in the input data 
set.

Applies to character-valued subgroup-variables and specifies that only the first 
occurrence of repeated, adjacent group values be labeled on the horizontal axis.
Disables transparency in ODS Graphics output, so that all graph features are opaque.
Suppresses line segments that connect points on a trend chart.
Overrides the vertical axis truncation at zero.
Suppresses the display of the upper control limit in a primary chart.
suppresses the display of the upper control limit in a secondary chart.
Requests that the vertical axis label be strung out vertically.

[Syntax: NPANELPOS=n] 
          
Specifies the number of subgroup positions per panel on each chart.
Specifies a label for the central line in an np chart.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: A quoted label up to 16 characters in length.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: NP

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Adds a footnote to ODS Graphics output.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: The value of SAS FOOTNOTE statement is used as the graph footnote.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: The value of SAS FOOTNOTE statement is used as the graph footnote.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: A quoted string is used as the graph footnote.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Adds a secondary footnote to ODS Graphics output.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: The value of SAS FOOTNOTE2 statement is used as the graph footnote.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: A quoted string is used as the secondary footnote.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies that legend entries contain all levels observed in the data.
Specifies a title for ODS Graphics output.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Uses the value of SAS TITLE statement as the graph title.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Uses the value of SAS TITLE statement as the graph title.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Suppresses all titles from the graph.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Uses the default ODS Graphics title (a descriptive title consisting of the plot type and  the process variable name.)
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Uses the default ODS Graphics title with the variable label instead of the variable name.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: A quoted string is used as the graph title.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies a secondary title for ODS Graphics output.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Uses the value of SAS TITLE2 statement as the secondary graph title.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: A quoted string is used as the secondary title.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: OUTBOX=SAS-data-set] 
          
Creates an output data set that contains subgroup summary statistics, control limits, and outlier 
values for a box chart.

Fills the areas outside the control limits that lie between the connected points 
and the control limits and are bounded by connecting lines.

[Syntax: OUTFILLOPACITY=value] 
          
Specifies the control limit outfill opacity when transparency is used in ODS Graphics 
output. The value must be between 0 and 1, where 0 is completely transparent and 1 is 
completely opaque. The default control limit outfill opacity is 0.25.

[Syntax: OUTHIGHHTML=variable] 
          
Specifies a variable whose values are URLs to be associated with outlier points 
above the upper fence on a schematic box plot when graphics output is directed 
into HTML.

[Syntax: OUTHISTORY=SAS-data-set] 
          
Creates an output data set that contains the subgroup summary statistics.

[Syntax: OUTINDEX='label'] 
          
Specifies the value of the _INDEX_ variable in the OUTLIMITS= output data set.

[Syntax: OUTLABEL=VALUE | OUTLABEL=(variable)] 
          
Labels each point that falls outside the control limits on the primary chart with the 
VALUE plotted for that subgroup or with the value of a variable in the input data set.

[Syntax: OUTLABEL2=VALUE | OUTLABEL2=(variable)] 
          
Labels each point that falls outside the control limits on an R or s chart with the 
VALUE plotted for that subgroup or with the value of a variable in the input data set.

[Syntax: OUTLIMITS=SAS-data-set] 
          
Creates an output data set that saves the control limits.

[Syntax: OUTLOWHTML=variable] 
          
Specifies a variable whose values are URLs to be associated with outlier points 
below the lower fence on a schematic box plot when graphics output is directed 
into HTML.

[Syntax: OUTPHASE='label'] 
          
Specifies the value of the _PHASE_ variable in the OUTHISTORY= data set.

[Syntax: OUTTABLE=SAS-data-set] 
          
Creates an output SAS data set that saves the information plotted on the chart, 
including the subgroup variable values and their corresponding summary statistics 
and control limits.

[Syntax: OVERLAY=(variable-list)] 
          
Specifies variables to be overlaid on the primary control chart.

[Syntax: OVERLAY2=(variable-list)] 
          
Specifies variables to be overlaid on a secondary control chart.

[Syntax: OVERLAY2HTML=(variable-list)] 
          
Specifies variables whose values are URLs to be associated with points on secondary 
chart overlays.

[Syntax: OVERLAY2ID=(variable-list)] 
          
Specifies variables whose formatted values are used to label points on secondary 
chart overlays.

[Syntax: OVERLAY2SYM=(symbol-list)] 
          
Specifies symbols used to plot overlays on a secondary control chart.

[Syntax: OVERLAYCLIPSYM=symbol] 
          
Specifies the symbol used to plot clipped values on overlay plots when the CLIPFACTOR= 
option is used.

[Syntax: OVERLAYCLIPSYMHT=value] 
          
Specifies the height for the symbol used to plot clipped values on overlay plots when the 
CLIPFACTOR= option is used.

[Syntax: OVERLAYHTML=(variable-list)] 
          
Specifies variables whose values are URLs to be associated with points on primary 
chart overlays.

[Syntax: OVERLAYID=(variable-list)] 
          
Specifies variables whose formatted values are used to label points on primary 
chart overlays.

[Syntax: OVERLAYLEGLAB='label'] 
          
Specifies the label displayed to the left of the overlay legend produced by the 
OVERLAY= or OVERLAY2= option. The label can be up to 16 characters and must be 
enclosed in quotes. The default label is "Overlays:".

[Syntax: OVERLAYSYM=(symbol-list)] 
          
Specifies symbols used to plot overlays on the primary control chart.

[Syntax: OVERLAYSYMHT=(value-list)] 
          
Specifies the heights of symbols used to plot overlays on the primary control chart.

[Syntax: P0=value] 
          
Specifies a known (standard) value po for the proportion of nonconforming items 
produced by the process.

[Syntax: PAGENUM='string'] 
          
Specifies the form of the label used for pagination. The string can be up to 16 
characters, and it must include one or two occurrences of the substitution character 
'#'. The first '#' is replaced with the page number, and the optional second '#' is 
replaced with the total number of pages.
Specifies where to position the page number requested with the PAGENUM= option.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Top left
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Top right
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Top left. TL100 ensures that the page number appears at the very top of a page  when a title is displayed.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Top right. TR100 ensures that the page number appears at the very top of a page  when a title is displayed.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip7: Bottom left. BL0 ensures that the page number appears at the very bottom of a page  when footnotes are displayed.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip8: Bottom right. BR0 ensures that the page number appears at the very bottom of a page  when footnotes are displayed.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies one of five definitions used to calculate percentiles in the construction 
of box-and-whiskers plots requested with the BOXCHART statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Definition 1 for computing quantile statistics
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Definition 2 for computing quantile statistics

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Draws phase labels as titles along the top of phase boxes.

Specifies that the last point in a phase (defined as a block of consecutive subgroups 
with the same value of the _PHASE_ variable) is not to be connected to the first 
point in the next phase.

Specifies how lengthy _PHASE_ variable values are to be displayed when there is 
insufficient space in the legend requested with the PHASELEGEND option.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: The values are uniformly reduced in height so that they fit.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Lengthy values are truncated on the right until they fit.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Identifies the phases requested with the READPHASES= option in a legend across the 
top of the chart.

Specifies that the control limits and center line are to be labeled for each phase 
specified with the READPHASES= option, providing the limits are constant within 
that phase.

[Syntax: PHASEMEANSYMBOL=symbol] 
          
Specifies a symbol marker for the average of the values plotted within a phase.
Specifies the vertical position of the phase legend.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Top of chart, offset from axis frame
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Top of chart, immediately above axis frame
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Bottom of chart, immediately above horizontal axis
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Bottom of chart, below horizontal axis label

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Delineates the phases specified with the READPHASES= option with reference lines 
drawn vertically.

Enables you to associate phase reference lines (block reference lines) with either 
the innermost or the outermost level.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Associates phase reference lines (block reference lines) with the innermost level.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Associates phase reference lines (block reference lines) with the outermost level.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: No association of phase reference lines (block reference lines) with the innermost  or outermost level.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Displays the label associated with the variable _PHASE_ above the phase values in the 
phase legend.
Displays vertical lines separating phase values in the phase legend.

[Syntax: POINTSHTML=variable] 
          
Specifies a variable whose values are URLs to be associated with points on a box chart 
when the BOXSTYLE= value is POINTS, POINTSJOIN, POINTSBOX, POINTSID, or POINTSJOINID.
Specifies a label for the central line in a P chart.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: P
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: PBAR
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Specifies a quoted label up to 16 characters.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Estimates the process standard deviation for a boxplot using subgroup ranges.

Specifies that the variable _ALPHA_, rather than the variable _SIGMAS_, is to be 
read from a LIMITS= data set when both variables are available in the data set.

[Syntax: READPHASES=value-list | ALL] 
          
Selects blocks of consecutive observations to be read from the input data set.

Specifies that the horizontal axis of a chart that spans multiple panels be arranged 
so that the last subgroup position on a panel is repeated as the first subgroup 
position on the next panel.
Specifies a label for the central line in an R chart.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: R
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: RBAR
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Specifies a quoted label up to 16 characters.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: RTMARGIN=value] 
          
Specifies the width of the right marginal area for the plot requested with the 
RTMPLOT= option.

Requests a univariate plot of the control chart statistics that is positioned in 
the right margin of the control chart.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Digidot plot
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Histogram
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Schematic box-and-whisker plot with outliers labeled
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Schematic box-and-whisker plot with far outliers labeled

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Displays primary and secondary charts on separate screens or pages.
Adds serifs to the whiskers of skeletal box-and-whisker charts.
Draws the central line labels using a simulated software font rather than a hardware font.

[Syntax: SKIPHLABELS=n] 
          
Specifies the number n of consecutive tick mark labels, beginning with the second 
tick mark label, that are thinned (not displayed) on the horizontal (subgroup) axis.

[Syntax: SPLIT='character'] 
          
Specifies a special character that is inserted into the label of a process variable 
or summary statistic variable and whose purpose is to split the label into two parts.
Specifies a label for the central line in an S chart.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: S
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: SBAR
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Specifies a quoted label up to 16 characters.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: STARBDRADIUS=value] 
          
Specifies the radius of an imaginary circle that is the outer bound for vertices 
of stars requested with the STARVERTICES= option.

[Syntax: STARCIRCLES=values] 
          
Specifies reference circles that are superimposed on the stars requested with the 
STARVERTICES= option.

[Syntax: STARINRADIUS=value] 
          
Specifies the inner radius of stars requested with the STARVERTICES= option. For 
traditional graphics, the radius is specified in horizontal percent screen units. 
For ODS Graphics output, the radius is 
specified in pixels.

[Syntax: STARFILL=variable] 
          
Specifies colors for filling the interior of stars requested with the STARVERTICES= option.
Specifies a method for labeling the vertices of stars requested with the STARVERTICES= option.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Labels all vertices of all stars.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Labels all vertices of the leftmost star.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Labels only vertices that lie outside the outer circle.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Labels only vertices that lie inside the inner circle.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Labels only vertices that lie inside the inner circle or outside the outer circle.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies the style of the legend used to identify the vertices of stars requested with the 
STARVERTICES= option.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Identifies the vertex variables by their positions on the clock (starting with 12:00)
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Identifies the vertex variables by their positions on the clock (starting with 0:00)
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Identifies the vertex variables by angles in degrees, with 0 degrees corresponding to 12 o'clock

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: STARLEGENDLAB='label'] 
          
Specifies the label displayed to the left of the legend for stars requested with the STARLEGEND= 
option. The label can be up to 16 characters and must be enclosed in quotes.

[Syntax: STAROPACITY=value] 
          
Specifies the star fill opacity when transparency is used in ODS Graphics output. 
The value must be between 0 and 1, where 0 is completely transparent and 1 is 
completely opaque. The default star fill opacity is 0.75.

[Syntax: STAROUTRADIUS=value] 
          
Specifies the outer radius of stars requested with the STARVERTICES= option.

[Syntax: STARS=variable] 
          
Specifies colors for the outlines of stars requested with the STARVERTICES= option.

[Syntax: STARSPECS=value|SAS-data-set] 
          
Specifies the method used to standardize the star vertex variables listed with the 
STARVERTICES= option.

[Syntax: STARSTART=value] 
          
Specifies the vertex angle for the first variable in the STARVERTICES= list.
Specifies the style of the stars requested with the STARVERTICES= option.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Polygon with star-vertices emanating from the inner circle
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Closed polygon
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Rays emanating from the inner circle
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Closed polygon with rays from the center to each vertex

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: STARVERTICES=variable | (variable-list)] 
          
Superimposes a star (polygon) at each point on the primary chart.

Specifies that the estimate of the process standard deviation, σ, is to be calculated 
from subgroup standard deviations.

[Syntax: SUBGROUPN=value] 
          
Specifies the subgroup sample sizes as a constant value or as the values of a variable 
in the DATA= data set.

[Syntax: SYMBOLCHARS='character-list'] 
          
Specifies a list of characters used to mark the points plotted on line printer 
charts when a symbol-variable is used.
Controls the legend for the levels of a symbol-variable.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: You can specify SYMBOLLEGEND=LEGENDn, where n is the number of a LEGEND statement defined previously.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Suppresses the default legend.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies the order in which symbols are assigned for levels of the symbol-variable.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Assigns symbols to values in the order in which values appear in the input data set.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Assigns symbols based on sorted order of internal values of the symbol variable
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Assigns them based on sorted formatted values.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: TABLES(EXCEPTIONS) | TABLE(EXCEPTIONS) 
          
Creates a basic table of the subgroup values, the subgroup sample sizes, the subgroup 
summary statistics, and the upper and lower control limits. Rows of the table correspond 
to subgroups. The keyword EXCEPTIONS restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for which 
the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

Syntax: TABLEBOX(EXCEPTIONS)
          
Augments the basic table created by the TABLES option with columns for the minimum, 
25th percentile, median, 75th percentile, and maximum of the observations in a subgroup.

Syntax: TABLECENTRAL(EXCEPTIONS) | TABLEC(EXCEPTIONS)
          
Augments the basic table created by the TABLES option with columns for the values 
of the central lines. The keyword EXCEPTIONS restricts the tabulation to those  
subgroups for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes 
is positive.

Syntax: TABLELEGEND(EXCEPTIONS)|TABLELEG(EXCEPTIONS)
          
Adds a legend to the basic table created by the TABLES option. The keyword EXCEPTIONS 
restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for which the control limits are exceeded 
or a test for special causes is positive.

Syntax: TABLEOUTLIM(EXCEPTIONS)|TABLEOUT(EXCEPTIONS) 
          
Augments the basic table created by the TABLES option with columns indicating which 
control limits (if any) are exceeded. The keyword EXCEPTIONS restricts the tabulation 
to those subgroups for which the control limits are exceeded or a test for special 
causes is positive.

Syntax: TABLETESTS(EXCEPTIONS)
          
Augments the basic table created by the TABLES option with a column that indicates 
which of the tests for special causes (requested with the TESTS= option) are positive. 
The keyword EXCEPTIONS restricts the tabulation to those subgroups for which the 
control limits are exceeded or a test for special causes is positive.

[Syntax: TARGET=value-list] 
          
Provides target values used to compute the capability index Cpm, which is saved 
in the OUTLIMITS= data set.

[Syntax: TEST2RESET=variable] 
          
Enables tests for special causes to be reset in a secondary chart. The specified 
variable must be a character variable of length 8, or length 16 if customized tests 
are requested.
Specifies the length of the pattern for Test 2 requested with the TESTS= and TESTS2= options.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: 7 in a row
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: 8 in a row
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: At least 10 out of 11 in a row
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: At least 12 out of 14 in a row
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: At least 16 out of 20 in a row

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies the length of the pattern for Test 3 requested with the TESTS= and TESTS2= options.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Length of the pattern is at least 6.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Length of the pattern is at least 7.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Length of the pattern is at least 8.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies that tests for special causes requested with the TESTS= or TESTS2= options 
be applied without regard to phases (blocks of consecutive subgroups) determined by 
the READPHASES= option and the variable _PHASE_ in the input data set.

[Syntax: TESTCHAR='character'] 
          
Specifies the character for the line segments that connect any sequence of points 
for which a test for special causes (requested with the TESTS= or TESTS2= option) 
is positive. The default character is the number of the test (with values 1 to 8).

[Syntax: TESTFONT=font] 
          
Specifies a software font for labels requested with the ALLLABEL=, ALLLABEL2=, 
OUTLABEL=, OUTLABEL2=, STARLABEL=, TESTLABEL=, and TESTLABEL= options.

[Syntax: TESTHEIGHT=value] 
          
Specifies the height (in vertical percent screen units) for labels requested with 
the ALLLABEL=, ALLLABEL2=, OUTLABEL=, OUTLABEL2=, STARLABEL=, TESTLABEL=, and 
TESTLABEL= options.

Requests that labels for subgroups with positive tests for special causes are 
positioned so they do not overlap. The labels are enclosed in boxes that are 
connected to the associated subgroup points with line segments.

Provides labels for points at which one of the tests for special causes (requested 
with the TESTS= or TESTS2= option) is positive.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Labels points with the single-digit index that requested the test in a TESTS= or TESTS2= list.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Request a label of the form Test k.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: A label of up to 16 characters enclosed in quotes.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: A variable (enclosed in parentheses) whose values are used as labels. The variable  must be provided in the input data set, and it can be numeric or character.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Applies the tests for special causes requested with the TESTS= and TESTS2= options 
to standardize test statistics when the subgroup sample sizes are not constant.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Applies the tests for special causes requested with the TESTS= and TESTS2= options  to standardize test statistics when the subgroup sample sizes are not constant.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Applies tests for special causes (requested with the TESTS= or TESTS2= option) to 
overlapping patterns of points.

[Syntax: TESTRESET=variable] 
          
Enables tests for special causes to be reset in a primary chart. The specified 
variable must be a character variable of length 8, or length 16 if customized 
tests are requested.

[Syntax: TESTS=index-list] 
          
Requests one or more tests for special causes, which are also known as runs tests, 
pattern tests, and Western Electric rules.

[Syntax: TESTS2=index-list] 
          
Requests one or more tests for special causes for an R chart or s chart.

[Syntax: TESTSYMBOL=symbol] 
          
Specifies the symbol for plotting subgroups with positive tests for special causes.

[Syntax: TESTSYMBOLHT=value] 
          
Specifies the height of the symbol used to plot subgroups with positive tests 
for special causes.

[Syntax: TOTPANELS=n] 
          
Specifies the total number of panels to be used to display the chart. This option 
overrides the NPANEL= option.

[Syntax: TRENDVAR=variable | (variable-list)] 
          
Specifies a list of trend variables, one for each process listed in the chart statement.

Turns the labels produced by the ALLLABEL=, ALLLABEL2=, OUTLABEL= and OUTLABEL2= options so that 
they are strung out vertically.

Turns the major tick mark labels for the horizontal (group) axis so that they are 
strung out vertically. By default, labels are arranged horizontally.

[Syntax: U0=value] 
          
Specifies a known (standard) value u0 for the average number u of nonconformities 
per unit produced by the process.

[Syntax: UCLLABEL='label'] 
          
Specifies a label for the upper control limit in the primary chart. The label can be 
up to 16 characters. Enclose the label in quotes.

[Syntax: UCLLABEL2='label'] 
          
Specifies a label for the upper control limit in the secondary chart. The label can 
be up to 16 characters. Enclose the label in quotes.

[Syntax: USL=value-list] 
          
Provides upper specification limits used to compute capability indices.
Specifies a label for the central line in a U chart.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: U
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: UBAR
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Specifies a quoted label up to 16 characters.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: VAXIS=value-list | VAXIS=AXISn] 
          
Specifies major tick mark values for the vertical axis of a primary chart. The 
values must be listed in increasing order, must be evenly spaced, and must span 
the range of values displayed in the chart.

[Syntax: VAXIS2=value-list | VAXIS2=AXISn] 
          
Specifies major tick mark values for the vertical axis of a secondary chart. The 
values must be listed in increasing order, must be evenly spaced, and must span 
the range of values displayed in the chart.

[Syntax: VFORMAT=format] 
          
Specifies a format to be used for displaying tick mark labels on the vertical axis 
of a primary chart.

[Syntax: VFORMAT2=format] 
          
Specifies a format to be used for displaying tick mark labels on the vertical axis 
of a secondary chart.

[Syntax: VMINOR=n] 
          
Specifies the number of minor tick marks between major tick marks on the vertical 
axis. Minor tick marks are not labeled. By default, VMINOR=0.

[Syntax: VOFFSET=value] 
          
Specifies the length in percent screen units of the offset at the ends of the 
vertical axis.

[Syntax: VREF=value-list | VREF=SAS-data-set] 
          
Draws reference lines perpendicular to the vertical axis on the primary chart.

[Syntax: VREF2=value-list | VREF2=SAS-data-set] 
          
Draws reference lines perpendicular to the vertical axis on the secondary chart.

[Syntax: VREF2LABELS='label1' ...'labeln' ] 
          
Specifies labels for the reference lines requested by the VREF= option. The number 
of labels must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can 
be up to 16 characters.

[Syntax: VREF2LABELS='label1' ...'labeln' ] 
          
Specifies labels for the reference lines requested by the VREF2= option. The number 
of labels must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can 
be up to 16 characters.

[Syntax: VREFCHAR='character'] 
          
Specifies the character used for reference lines requested by the VREF= and VREF2= 
options on line printer charts. The default is the hyphen (-).
Specifies the horizontal position of the VREFLABEL= and VREF2LABEL= labels.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Left-justified in subplot area
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Right-justified in subplot area

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Forces the origin to be included in the vertical axis for a primary chart.
Forces the origin to be included in the vertical axis for a secondary chart.

[Syntax: WAXIS=n] 
          
Specifies the width in pixels for the axis and frame lines. By default, n=1.

[Syntax: WEBOUT=SAS-data-set] 
          
Produces an output data set containing all the data in an OUTTABLE= data set plus 
graphics coordinates for points (subgroup summary statistics) that are displayed 
on a control chart.

[Syntax: WGRID=n] 
          
Specifies the width in pixels for grid lines requested with the ENDGRID and GRID 
options. By default, n=1.

[Syntax: WLIMITS=n] 
          
Specifies the width in pixels for the control limits and central line. By default, n=1.

[Syntax: WNEEDLES=n] 
          
Specifies the width in pixels of needles connecting plotted points to the central line, 
as requested with the NEEDLES option.

[Syntax: WOVERLAY=(value-list)] 
          
Specifies the widths in pixels for the line segments connecting points on primary chart 
overlay plots.

[Syntax: WOVERLAY2=(value-list)] 
          
Specifies the widths in pixels for the line segments connecting points on secondary 
chart overlay plots.

[Syntax: WSTARCIRCLES=n] 
          
Specifies the width in pixels of the outline of circles requested by the 
STARCIRCLES= option.

[Syntax: WSTARS=n] 
          
Specifies the width in pixels of the outline of stars requested by the 
STARVERTICES= option.

[Syntax: WTESTS=n] 
          
Specifies the width in pixels of the line segments that connect patterns of points 
for which a test for special causes (requested with the TESTS= or TESTS2= option) 
is positive. By default, n=1.

[Syntax: WTREND=n] 
          
Specifies the width in pixels of the line segments that connect points on trend charts 
requested with the TRENDVAR= option. By default, n=1.
Specifies a label for the central line in an XBAR chart or a median chart.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: a quoted label up to 16 characters
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: MBAR

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: YPCT1=value] 
          
Specifies a percent (ranging from 0 to 100) that determines the length of the vertical 
axis for the primary chart in proportion to the sum of the lengths of the vertical axes 
for the primary and secondary charts.

Scales the vertical axis on a P chart in percent units. The YSCALE= option is available 
only in the PCHART statement.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Scales the vertical axis on a P chart in percent units.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies that a control chart is to be constructed and displayed regardless of whether 
the estimated process standard deviation is zero.
Suppresses the display of the degenerate limits.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Suppresses the display of the degenerate limits.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Adds the labels A, B, and C to zone lines requested with the ZONES2 or ZONE2VALUES options.
Labels R or s chart zones lines with their values. If the ZONE2VALUES option is specified the ZONES2 option is not required.

[Syntax: ZONECHAR='character'] 
          
Specifies the character used to form the zone lines requested by the ZONES option.
Adds the labels A, B, and C to zone lines requested with the ZONES or ZONEVALUES options.

Adds lines to a primary chart that delineate zones A, B, and C for standard tests requested with the
TESTS= option.
Adds lines to an R or s chart that delineate zones A, B, and C for tests requested with the TESTS2= option.
Specifies the horizontal position of the ZONEVALUES= and ZONE2VALUES= labels.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Left-justified in subplot area
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Right-justified in subplot area

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Labels the primary chart zones lines with their values. If the ZONEVALUES option is specified the 
ZONES option is not required.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: INSET keyword-list < / options >; 
      
The INSET statement enables you to enhance a cusum chart by adding a box or table 
(referred to as an inset) of summary statistics directly to the graph. Each INSET 
statement produces a separate inset and must follow an XCHART statement.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: CFILL=color | BLANK] 
          
Specifies the color of the background (including the header background if you do not 
specify the CFILLH= option). CFILL=BLANK leaves the background uncolored and prevents 
items from showing through the inset.
Leaves the background uncolored and prevents items from showing through the inset.

[Syntax: CFILLH=color] 
          
Specifies the color of the header background. By default, if you do not specify a 
CFILLH= color, the CFILL= color is used.

[Syntax: CFRAME=color] 
          
Specifies the color of the frame. By default, the frame is the same color as the axis 
of the plot.

[Syntax: CHEADER=color] 
          
Specifies the color of the header text. By default, if you do not specify a CHEADER= 
color, the CTEXT= color is used.

[Syntax: CSHADOW=color] 
          
Specifies the color of the drop shadow.

[Syntax: CTEXT=color] 
          
Specifies the color of the text. By default, the inset text color is the same as the 
other text on the plot.
Specifies that data coordinates are to be used in positioning the inset with the POSITION= option.

[Syntax: FONT=font | SMALL] 
          
Specifies the font of the text. By default, the font is SIMPLEX if the inset is located 
in the interior of the plot, and the font is the same as the other text displayed on the 
plot if the inset is located in the exterior of the plot. 

When you specify FONT=SMALL, the GraphValueText font is used in the header and the 
GraphDataText font is used in the inset body.

When you specify FONT=SMALL, the GraphValueText font is used in the header and the 
GraphDataText font is used in the inset body.

[Syntax: FORMAT=format] 
          
Specifies a format for all the values displayed in an inset.

[Syntax: HEADER= 'string'] 
          
Specifies the header text. The string cannot exceed 40 characters.

[Syntax: HEIGHT=value | SMALL] 
          
Specifies the height of the text in screen percent units. 

HEIGHT=SMALL reduces the size of the text in the inset. When you specify HEIGHT=SMALL, 
the GraphValueText size is used for the inset header and the GraphDataText size is used 
in the inset body.

Reduces the size of the text in the inset. When you specify HEIGHT=SMALL, the GraphValueText 
size is used for the inset header and the GraphDataText size is used in the inset body.

[Syntax: HOPACITY=value] 
          
Specifies the inset header background opacity when transparency is used in ODS 
Graphics output. The value must be between 0 and 1, where 0 is completely 
transparent and 1 is completely opaque. The defaultinset header background 
opacity is 0.35.
Suppresses the frame drawn around the text.

[Syntax: OPACITY=value] 
          
Specifies the inset background opacity when transparency is used in ODS Graphics 
output. The value must be between 0 and 1, where 0 is completely transparent and 
1 is completely opaque. The default inset background opacity is 0.95.

[Syntax: POSITION=position] 
          
Determines the position of the inset. The position can be a compass point keyword, 
a margin keyword, or a pair of coordinates (x,y). You can specify coordinates in 
axis percent units or axis data units.

Specifies the reference point for an inset that is positioned by a pair of coordinates 
with the POSITION= option.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Bottom right
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Bottom left
